protocol.name: P-AFFY-2
protocol.text: Labeling of samples was carried out according to the manufacturer’s standard protocol

protocol.name: P-MEXP-101651
protocol.text: 50-100 Arabidopsis thaliana seeds were vapor sterilized overnight. At 8 A.M., seeds were imbibed on plates containing ½ LS media with 0.8% agar at pH 5.8. Seeds were stratified for 3 days at 4°C and at 8 A.M. on the fourth day they were released into short day conditions of 8 hours light (100 µmol/m2s) and 16 hours dark at 22°C. After seven days of growth, plants were harvested starting at the dark to light transition of the eighth day.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-101652
protocol.text: Collected tissue was immediately frozen in liquid nitrogen in 2 ml eppindorph tubes with three steel ball bearings and stored at -80°C. Frozen tissue was disrupted on a Retsch shaker under liquid nitrogen. RNA was extracted using QIAGEN RNAeasy kits with on column DNAase treatment and resuspended in 35 µl RNAase-free H2O.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-101654
protocol.text: Seedlings (50-100) from individual plates were collected every four hours.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-102782
protocol.text: 50-100 Arabidopsis thaliana seeds were vapor sterilized overnight. At 8 A.M., seeds were imbibed on plates containing ½ LS media with 0.8% agar at pH 5.8. Seeds were stratified for 3 days at 4°C and at 8 A.M. on the fourth day they were released into continuous light (LL: 100 µmol/m2s) and thermocycles (HC: 12 hours at 22°C and 12 hrs at 12°C). After seven days of growth, plants were harvested starting at the dark to light transition of the eighth day.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-102787
protocol.text: 50-100 Arabidopsis thaliana seeds were vapor sterilized overnight. At 8 A.M., seeds were imbibed on plates containing ½ LS media with 0.8% agar at pH 5.8. Seeds were stratified for 3 days at 4°C and at 8 A.M. on the fourth day they were released into photocycles (LD:12 hours light [100 µmol/m2s] and 12 hours dark) and thermocycles (HC: 12 hours at 22°C and 12 hrs at 12°C). The photocycles and thermocycles were overlapping so that temperature increased when the lights came on and temperature decreased when the lights went off. After seven days of growth, plants were harvested starting at the dark to light transition of the eighth day.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-102788
protocol.text: 50-100 Arabidopsis thaliana seeds were vapor sterilized overnight. At 8 A.M., seeds were imbibed on plates containing ½ LS media with 0.8% agar at pH 5.8 plus 3% sucrose. Seeds were stratified for 3 days at 4°C and at 8 A.M. on the fourth day they were released into long day conditions of 16 hours light (100 µmol/m2s) and 8 hours dark at 22°C. After seven days of growth, plants were harvested starting at the dark to light transition of the eighth day.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-102789
protocol.text: 50-100 Arabidopsis thaliana seeds were vapor sterilized overnight. At 8 A.M., seeds were imbibed on plates containing ½ LS media with 0.8% agar at pH 5.8. Seeds were stratified for 3 days at 4°C and at 8 A.M. on the fourth day they were released into photocycles (LD:12 hours light [100 µmol/m2s] and 12 hours dark) and thermocycles (HC: 12 hours at 22°C and 12 hrs at 12°C). The photocycles and thermocycles were overlapping so that temperature increased when the lights came on and temperature decreased when the lights went off. On the ninth day, plants were released into circadian conditions of continuous light (100 µmol/m2s) and temperature (22°C). Plants were harvested starting at the dark to light transition of the ninth day.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-102790
protocol.text: 50-100 Arabidopsis thaliana seeds were vapor sterilized overnight. At 8 A.M., seeds were imbibed on plates containing ½ LS media with 0.8% agar at pH 5.8. Seeds were stratified for 3 days at 4°C and at 8 A.M. on the fourth day they were released into continuous light (LL: 100 µmol/m2s) and thermocycles (HC: 12 hours at 22°C and 12 hrs at 12°C). On the ninth day, plants were released into circadian conditions of continuous light (100 µmol/m2s) and temperature (22°C). Plants were harvested starting at the dark to light transition of the ninth day.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-102792
protocol.text: 100-500 Arabidopsis thaliana seeds were vapor sterilized overnight. At 8 A.M., seeds were imbibed on plates containing ½ LS media with 0.8% agar at pH 5.8 plus 3% sucrose. Seeds were stratified for 3 days at 4°C and at 8 A.M. on the fourth day they were released into continuous dark and thermocycles (HC: 12 hours at 22°C and 12 hrs at 12°C). On the seventh day, plants were released into circadian conditions of temperature (22°C) and maintained in continuous dark. Plants were harvested starting at subjective dawn on the seventh day. Seedlings never experienced the light during this time course.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-102793
protocol.text: Array normalization was carried out using standard tools implemented in the Bioconductor package gcRMA. Resulting normalized data was unlogged.
